title: Did Apalachee high school receive shooting threat before mass attack? Georgia official clarify
content: A tragic shooting at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, resulted in four deaths and nine injuries. Initial reports of a warning about the attack were debunked by authorities. The investigation is ongoing to determine how 14-year-old Colt Gray obtained and brought an AR-15 rifle into the school.
summary: A tragic shooting at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, resulted in four deaths and nine injuries. Initial reports of a warning about the attack were debunked by authorities. The investigation is ongoing to determine how 14-year-old Colt Gray obtained and brought an AR-15 rifle into the school.

title: Apalachee high school tragedy: Georgia shooting claims lives of two students and two teachers — who were the victims?
content: A shooting at Apalachee High School in Georgia left two students and two teachers dead. Victims included Mason Schermerhorn, Christian Angulo, Richard Aspinwall, and Christina Irimie. Suspect Colt Gray was apprehended shortly after the incident. Nine others were injured but are expected to recover. Authorities are investigating the motive behind the attack.
summary: A shooting at Apalachee High School in Georgia left two students and two teachers dead. Victims included Mason Schermerhorn, Christian Angulo, Richard Aspinwall, and Christina Irimie. Suspect Colt Gray was apprehended shortly after the incident. Nine others were injured but are expected to recover. Authorities are investigating the motive behind the attack.

title: EasyJet flight makes emergency landing after drunk passenger calls captain ‘rubbish', tries to open exit door: Watch video
content: An EasyJet flight from London to Greece was forced to make an emergency landing in Munich due to a disruptive passenger. The intoxicated man attempted to storm the cockpit and open an exit door, leading to chaos on board. He was subdued by the crew and passengers before being removed by German police.
summary: An EasyJet flight from London to Greece was forced to make an emergency landing in Munich due to a disruptive passenger. The intoxicated man attempted to storm the cockpit and open an exit door, leading to chaos on board. He was subdued by the crew and passengers before being removed by German police.

title: 'Entirely baseless, fabricated': China rejects New Zealand's spy report
content: China refuted New Zealand's allegations of foreign interference against its Chinese communities, labeling them as baseless fabrications. The New Zealand Security Intelligence Service expressed ongoing concerns about foreign interference, particularly from China. The Chinese embassy criticized the report for inciting fear and division while underscoring the importance of their bilateral relationship.
summary: China refuted New Zealand's allegations of foreign interference against its Chinese communities, labeling them as baseless fabrications. The New Zealand Security Intelligence Service expressed ongoing concerns about foreign interference, particularly from China. The Chinese embassy criticized the report for inciting fear and division while underscoring the importance of their bilateral relationship.

title: Chinese cities suspend schools, cancel flights ahead of super typhoon Yagi
content: Southern China has suspended schools and flights as tropical storm Yagi turns into a super typhoon heading towards Hainan. The storm has already caused deadly floods in the Philippines. Hong Kong braces for strong winds, while Vietnam readies its military and coastal measures for Yagi's expected impact.
summary: Southern China has suspended schools and flights as tropical storm Yagi turns into a super typhoon heading towards Hainan. The storm has already caused deadly floods in the Philippines. Hong Kong braces for strong winds, while Vietnam readies its military and coastal measures for Yagi's expected impact.

title: UN's Guterres says 'injustices' against Africa must be corrected
content: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has called for Africa to be granted a permanent seat on the UN Security Council to address historic injustices. Speaking at the China-Africa forum, he noted Africa's debt challenges and praised China's development achievements as a model for sustainable growth and cooperation in trade, technology, and other areas.
summary: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has called for Africa to be granted a permanent seat on the UN Security Council to address historic injustices. Speaking at the China-Africa forum, he noted Africa's debt challenges and praised China's development achievements as a model for sustainable growth and cooperation in trade, technology, and other areas.

title: 'Nebraska Walz’s for Trump' shirts spark apostrophe debate on X, social media explodes over grammar fail
content: A family photo featuring pro-Trump shirts worn by distant relatives of Kamala's running mate Tim Walz has gone viral due to a grammatical error. The shirts read 'Nebraska Walz’s for Trump,' with an incorrectly placed apostrophe, sparking widespread amusement and criticism online. Grammar enthusiasts quickly pointed out the mistake, turning the political moment into a humorous lesson in punctuation.
summary: A family photo featuring pro-Trump shirts worn by distant relatives of Kamala's running mate Tim Walz has gone viral due to a grammatical error. The shirts read 'Nebraska Walz’s for Trump,' with an incorrectly placed apostrophe, sparking widespread amusement and criticism online. Grammar enthusiasts quickly pointed out the mistake, turning the political moment into a humorous lesson in punctuation.

title: Beluga whale Hvaldimir with 'Russian Spy' past allegedly shot: 'Multiple bullet wounds found on body'
content: Hvaldimir, a beluga whale with mysterious origins and viral fame in Norway, was found dead on the southwestern coast. Animal rights groups allege he was shot and call for a criminal investigation. Hvaldimir first gained attention in 2019 when he appeared wearing a harness, sparking speculation about his possible ties to the Russian military.
summary: Hvaldimir, a beluga whale with mysterious origins and viral fame in Norway, was found dead on the southwestern coast. Animal rights groups allege he was shot and call for a criminal investigation. Hvaldimir first gained attention in 2019 when he appeared wearing a harness, sparking speculation about his possible ties to the Russian military.

title: Hunter Biden’s legal troubles intensify: All you need to know about tax trial
content: Hunter Biden's tax trial is set to begin in Los Angeles, focusing on charges of tax evasion and filing false returns. The case follows a collapsed plea deal and a previous gun charge conviction. With significant implications for the Biden family, the trial will scrutinize Hunter's financial dealings and personal struggles.
summary: Hunter Biden's tax trial is set to begin in Los Angeles, focusing on charges of tax evasion and filing false returns. The case follows a collapsed plea deal and a previous gun charge conviction. With significant implications for the Biden family, the trial will scrutinize Hunter's financial dealings and personal struggles.

title: Trump shouts out Brittany Mahomes, Swifties wonder: What about Taylor?
content: Donald Trump acknowledged Brittany Mahomes, wife of Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes, on social media after she showed support for him. This has sparked online discussions and contrasts with Taylor Swift's political endorsements. The situation adds a layer of intrigue to their public appearances ahead of the Super Bowl.
summary: Donald Trump acknowledged Brittany Mahomes, wife of Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes, on social media after she showed support for him. This has sparked online discussions and contrasts with Taylor Swift's political endorsements. The situation adds a layer of intrigue to their public appearances ahead of the Super Bowl.

title: Taiwan’s only friend in Africa skips Chinese leader’s big summit
content: King Mswati III of Eswatini was absent from Xi Jinping's Forum on China-Africa Cooperation due to Eswatini's diplomatic ties with Taiwan. The kingdom remains Taiwan's sole ally in Africa, resisting China's efforts to isolate Taiwan. Eswatini values Taiwan's support and avoids entanglement in Chinese infrastructure projects and loans.
summary: King Mswati III of Eswatini was absent from Xi Jinping's Forum on China-Africa Cooperation due to Eswatini's diplomatic ties with Taiwan. The kingdom remains Taiwan's sole ally in Africa, resisting China's efforts to isolate Taiwan. Eswatini values Taiwan's support and avoids entanglement in Chinese infrastructure projects and loans.

title: Gazan teen musician found new life in playing his oud for children amid war, watch video
content: Fifteen-year-old Youssef Saad from Gaza plays his oud for children at a local day centre amid ongoing conflict. Despite losing his home and music school, he remains committed to bringing hope through music. The violence has disrupted many lives, including Saad's family, but he continues to inspire with his dedication.
summary: Fifteen-year-old Youssef Saad from Gaza plays his oud for children at a local day centre amid ongoing conflict. Despite losing his home and music school, he remains committed to bringing hope through music. The violence has disrupted many lives, including Saad's family, but he continues to inspire with his dedication.

title: Harris-Trump presidential debate key details: Kamala accepts rules to debate Donald, including muted mics
content: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump will face off in a presidential debate on September 10, amid controversy over microphone rules. Harris accepted ABC News' guidelines to address concerns from Trump's team. Moderated by David Muir and Linsey Davis, the debate will air on ABC and stream online.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump will face off in a presidential debate on September 10, amid controversy over microphone rules. Harris accepted ABC News' guidelines to address concerns from Trump's team. Moderated by David Muir and Linsey Davis, the debate will air on ABC and stream online.

title: Georgia school shooting: Survivor describes Colt Gray as ‘quiet guy who never really talked,’ recalls chilling moments before he opened fire at Apalachee high
content: Lyela Sayarath provides an account of the moments before Colt Gray's shooting at Apalachee High School. Known for his quiet nature and frequent absences, Gray left algebra class only to return with a gun. The incident resulted in the death of 14-year-old Mason Schermerhorn and injuries to nine others before Gray surrendered.
summary: Lyela Sayarath provides an account of the moments before Colt Gray's shooting at Apalachee High School. Known for his quiet nature and frequent absences, Gray left algebra class only to return with a gun. The incident resulted in the death of 14-year-old Mason Schermerhorn and injuries to nine others before Gray surrendered.

title: 'Very demure, very mindful' takes center stage as TikTok creator Jools Lebron tries to trademark viral phrase
content: TikTok star Jools Lebron seeks to trademark her viral catchphrase 'very demure, very mindful,' which gained popularity in August. This move aims to cover entertainment and advertising services while supporting her transition as a transgender woman. The trademark filings face competition from others attempting to capitalize on the trend.
summary: TikTok star Jools Lebron seeks to trademark her viral catchphrase 'very demure, very mindful,' which gained popularity in August. This move aims to cover entertainment and advertising services while supporting her transition as a transgender woman. The trademark filings face competition from others attempting to capitalize on the trend.

title: HL: 'Will not leave Gaza border until ...': Netanyahu sets conditions for permanent ceasefire
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that Israel will not vacate the Gaza border corridor until there are guarantees against its use by Hamas for smuggling weapons. He stressed the need for consistent prevention measures. The US is formulating a new ceasefire proposal, but Hamas has rejected all aspects of it so far.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that Israel will not vacate the Gaza border corridor until there are guarantees against its use by Hamas for smuggling weapons. He stressed the need for consistent prevention measures. The US is formulating a new ceasefire proposal, but Hamas has rejected all aspects of it so far.

title: Boeing’s Starliner set to fly solo back to earth — Nasa astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore left behind on ISS
content: Nasa's Starliner capsule is scheduled to undock from the ISS, landing in New Mexico after overcoming various issues. The capsule returns without astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams, who stay on the ISS until February. Departure adjustments aim for safety and data collection, reflecting ongoing challenges in Nasa's commercial crew program.
summary: Nasa's Starliner capsule is scheduled to undock from the ISS, landing in New Mexico after overcoming various issues. The capsule returns without astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams, who stay on the ISS until February. Departure adjustments aim for safety and data collection, reflecting ongoing challenges in Nasa's commercial crew program.

title: Trump says his debate strategy is to give Harris room to speak
content: Donald Trump has announced he will let Kamala Harris speak without interruption during their upcoming presidential debate. This shift comes as the candidates prepare for a crucial face-off hosted by ABC News in Philadelphia. Both campaigns have clashed over microphone rules, with the debate being pivotal for swaying Pennsylvania's swing state voters.
summary: Donald Trump has announced he will let Kamala Harris speak without interruption during their upcoming presidential debate. This shift comes as the candidates prepare for a crucial face-off hosted by ABC News in Philadelphia. Both campaigns have clashed over microphone rules, with the debate being pivotal for swaying Pennsylvania's swing state voters.

title: US elections 2024: Trump and Harris neck-and-neck in key battleground states, new poll shows
content: A recent survey indicates a close contest between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris in critical battleground states. Both candidates are tied at 47% support in Pennsylvania, while Harris narrowly leads Trump 48%-47% in Georgia. The poll also shows Harris ahead in Michigan and Wisconsin, with Trump leading in Arizona. The upcoming debate could be decisive.
summary: A recent survey indicates a close contest between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris in critical battleground states. Both candidates are tied at 47% support in Pennsylvania, while Harris narrowly leads Trump 48%-47% in Georgia. The poll also shows Harris ahead in Michigan and Wisconsin, with Trump leading in Arizona. The upcoming debate could be decisive.

title: Russian lawmakers denounce US sanctions against Russian state media network
content: Russian lawmakers have criticised US sanctions against state media group RT, labelling them as an attack on freedom of speech. The US justice department accused RT employees of attempting to influence the presidential election through a money-laundering scheme. Russian officials deny these allegations and accuse the US of interfering in their domestic matters.
summary: Russian lawmakers have criticised US sanctions against state media group RT, labelling them as an attack on freedom of speech. The US justice department accused RT employees of attempting to influence the presidential election through a money-laundering scheme. Russian officials deny these allegations and accuse the US of interfering in their domestic matters.
